All, I have 3 tsuba I have been asked to share with you by a friend. 
They =
are all rather interesting and as he had some questions about their 
origin=
, I said I would pass them on here to get the collective opinions 
of the g=
roup.

1: This he thought may be Tosh=F4. I thought myself, Saotome maybe. =
It 
appears to be in the style of Nobuiye with a design of the moon, the su=
n 
and the stars.

85mm x 79mm x 3mm.

http://www.nihontomessageboard.com/p=
ersonal/yamato_sword/tsuba_01.jpg

2: This one has the distinction of being=
 maybe/apparently a Ninja Tsuba. 
Ok, so I myself don't believe in Ninja, n=
ot in the sense that we see 
them in the films and think that if indeed, th=
ey existed past being 
runners and murderers, and they used a sword, it wou=
ld probably have 
been pretty normal in it's shape and fittings, anyway, be=
sides what I 
think LOL.

This is a nice little tsuba, it is obviously made=
 for a katana going by 
the size of the nakago ana, and the crescent moon H=
itsu ana ume are very 
nice. We think they may have had shakudo on them, th=
ough I was wondering 
if it would have been the black patina that covers si=
lver ??. It's a 
nice little piece.

73mm x 63mm x 4mm

http://www.nihontom=
essageboard.com/personal/yamato_sword/tsuba_02.jpg

3: This last one is sig=
ned and dated. OMI J=DB TSUNA (?) HIDE. I think it 
is Tsuna, I am pretty s=
ure it is in fact. and dated ( hard to read the 
day but I think it is ) AN=
SEI YONNEN NIGATSU GOHI. 5th of Feb, 1857. It 
was sold as a possible "Exec=
utioners Tsuba". It is quite thick, it's 
dimensions are 76mm x 69mm x 7mm =
and the Nakago ana is very large 
supposedly making it a " one size fits al=
l" sort of thing with I guess, 
fresh Sekigane added each time.

I have no =
idea if that is what this was or is, as I said, we are opening 
them up for=
 discussion and would be interested in all  your thoughts.

http://www.niho=
ntomessageboard.com/personal/yamato_sword/tsuba_03.jpg

Cheers and thanks f=
or taking the time to read.

Rich Turner
